body:
### Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.

I had the idea to run `scan-build setup.py` in CI to statically analyze Cython (and C) code. Having a `__cinit__` with any arg produces code that gets a warning for
> Array access (from variable 'kwvalues') results in a null pointer dereference [core.NullDereference]

I don't consider this a bug, because I wouldn't know how to trigger it, but I don't know the code well enough to know for sure.

Here is a minimal reproducer: https://github.com/black-sliver/scan-build-cython-test
The repo has a gh action run that has a report attached as artifact.

### Describe the solution you'd like.

Probably either not calling __Pyx_ParseOptionalKeywords when it makes no sense, or adding an extra null check, but I am really no expert on that matter.

### Describe alternatives you've considered.

* `-disable-checker core.NullDereference`, but that kind of defeats the purpose.
* Not using `__cinit__`. In the project I wanted to implement this, we actually ended up not using `__cinit__`, so this doesn't have the highest priority *for me*.

### Additional context

_No response_
title: [ENH] Allow using scan-build/clang static analyzer with `__cinit__`
